Speaker: the searchers
Dialogue: "THE SEARCHERS"  Revised Final Screenplay by  Frank Nugent

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Ethan?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Hello, Aaron...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Martha...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Hello, Ethan.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: How's California?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: How should I know?

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: But Mose Harper said...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That old goat still creakin' around?... Whyn't someone bury him?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Ben, ain't you?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Lucy, you ain't much bigger than when I saw you last.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: I'm Deborah!  She's Lucy.

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Lucy's going on seventeen now...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: An' she's got a beau! Kisses him, too!

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: That's enough... Go on inside and help Lucy set the table... You, too, Deborah!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: MOMENTO!

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Martin!... Here we've been standing... Ethan, you haven't forgotten Martin?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Oh... Mistook you for a half-breed.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Not quite... Quarter Cherokee. The rest is Welsh... So they tell me.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You've done a lot of growin'...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: It was Ethan found you squallin' in a sage clump after your folks was massacred...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: It just happened to be me... No need to make any more of it...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I'll take care of your horse for you, Uncle Ethan.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Hold on!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'll take this...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Supper'll be ready by the time you wash up... Let me take your coat for you, Ethan.

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: And... welcome home.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Ben! Deborah! Bed!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: But I've got to help with the dishes.

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Not tonight... Ben, put that sword back.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It's not a sword, ma... it's a saber!  Did you kill many damYankees with this sabre, Uncle Ethan?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Some...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: How many damYankees, Uncle Ethan?

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Ben!... Martin, he'll sleep in the bunkhouse with you tonight.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Good night, Aunt Martha... Uncle Aaron...  Good night, Uncle Ethan.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Night.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Will you tell me tomorrow about the war?

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: The war ended three years ago, boy!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It did?... Then whyn't you come home before now?

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: BEN!... Go 'long with Martin. MARCH!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Lucy's wearing the gold locket you gave her when she was a little girl...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Oh?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: She don't wear it much account of it makes her neck green.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Deborah!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Well, it does... But I wouldn't care if you gave me a gold locket if it made my neck green or not.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: 'Fraid I...  Wait.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: How about this?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Oh! LOOK! My gold locket!

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: It's solid gold... Ethan, I don't think she's old enough...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Let her keep it... Just something I picked up in Mexico.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Oh, thank you, Uncle Ethan...

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Come along...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Passed the Todd place comin' in... What happened to 'em?

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: They gave up... went back to the cotton rows... So'd the Jamisons... Without Martha, I don't know... She wouldn't let a man quit.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: You wanted to clear out!

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: And you stayed out beyond all need to... WHY?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You askin' me to clear out now?

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: You're my brother... You're welcome to stay as long as you got a mind to... Ain't that so, Martha?

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Of course he is.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I expect to pay my own way...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: There's sixty double eagles in there... twelve-hundred dollars.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: An' twice that in here.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: ...only these got the late Emperor Maximilian's picture on 'em.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Mint fresh... not a mark on 'em.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: So?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Cut yourself?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You were always hurting about your hands.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Time for bed...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Night, Ethan... Come 'long, Martha.

Speaker: sam's voice
Dialogue: Aaron! Open up!... Sam Clayton!

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Reverend... Come in!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Sorry to get you out of bed so early...  Mornin', Sister Edwards.

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: What is it, Reverend?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Lars Jorgensen claims someone bust into his corral last night and run off his best cows...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: You mean those pure breds he just bought?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Next time I raise pigs, by golly! You never hear of anyone running off pigs, I bet you.

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Injuns has 'em... Caddoes or Kiowas... Kiowas or Caddoes.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Caddoes!

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Respects to a charmin' lady, ma'am. ...Respects, respects...

Speaker: nesby
Dialogue: Mornin'...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Coffee's made if you...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Coffee'd be fine, sister...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: My bones is cold...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Or bumble bees, by golly... I show them dirty rustlers!

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Lookit me, old Mose Harper, rockin' in a rockin' chair... I'm a-goin' to set 'n rock, 'n rock, 'n rock, 'n rock...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Over here, Martin... Aaron...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Raise your right hands.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: You are hereby volunteer privates in Company A of the Texas Rangers and will faithfully discharge the duties of same without recompense or monetary compensation -- meaning no pay!... Amen and get your shirt on, will you, Aaron.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Ain't goin' volunteerin' after rustlers without my morning coffee, Reverend... Drink your own!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: From now on, call me 'Captain'!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Captain the Reverend Samuel Johnson Clayton!... Mighty impressive.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Well... the prodigal brother... When'd you get back?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Haven't seen you since the surrender.  Come to think of it, I didn't see you at the surrender.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I don't believe in surrenderin'... I still got my sabre, Reverend... never turned it into any ploughshare neither!

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Is no time for kaffee-klatch while a man's beef is been run off.

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Injuns, Ethan...  Caddoes or Kiowas... Mose Harper, drinkin' coffee in a rockin' chair. ...ay-eh!

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Ethan, countin' on you to look after things while I'm gone.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You ain't goin'...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: He sure is goin'... He's sworn in.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, swear him out again!... I'll go with you.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Now, Ethan, I ain't sure...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Don't argue!... And stay close... Maybe they're rustlers... and maybe this dodderin' old idiot ain't so far wrong...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Thankin' ye, Ethan... thankin' ye. Kind words...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: All right... I'll swear you in...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You can forget that...  Wouldn't be legal anyway.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Why?  You wanted for a crime, Ethan?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You askin' as a Reverend or a Captain, Sam?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: I'm askin' as a Ranger of the sovereign state of Texas.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Got a warrant?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: You fit a lot of descriptions.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: So did you, Reverend...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Stick close, Aaron...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Brad!... Is no time for lolly- gagging...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Looks like I'll be reading the lines over that pair before long, sister Edwards.

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Is no time for talking weddings... Better say prayers for those dirty thieves, by golly... running off a man's beef...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Grateful to the hospitality of yore rockin' chair, ma'am...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Let's get on with it...

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: WAIT!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Martin! Ride me as far as the well!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Grab hold!...

Speaker: aaron's voice
Dialogue: DEBORAH!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Uncle Ethan!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Somethin' mighty fishy about this trail, Uncle Ethan...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Stop callin' me 'uncle'... I ain't your uncle.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Don't have to call me 'sir' neither... Nor grampaw neither... Nor Methuselah neither... I can whup you to a frazzle.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: What you want me to call you?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Name's Ethan... Now what's so mighty fishy about this trail?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Well, fust off...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Look! Look!

Speaker: jorgensen's voice
Dialogue: Brad! He's found them... Come on!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Call that young fool back!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Caddo or Kiowa, huh?... Ain't but one tribe uses a lance like that!

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Ay-he... Comanch!

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Killed every one -- an' not for food either... Why'd they do a thing like that?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Stealing the cattle was just to pull us out... This here's a murder raid...  It shapes up to scald out either your place... or my brother's.

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Mama!... Oh please... please no... BRAD!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Jorgensen's place is closest... If they're not there, we'll come straight on!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Well, come on!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Easy!  It's forty miles, sonny... Horses can do with some grain and a little rest.

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Comanch generally hits at moonrise.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Moonrise!... It'll be midnight before... I ain't waitin'...!

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Wisht it was Caddoes... or Kiowas...  Comanche...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Think I'll see if I can pick off a sage-hen or two, Martha...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: You do that, Aaron...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Won't go far...

Speaker: lucy's voice
Dialogue: My, the days are getting shorter!

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Lucy!... We don't need the lamp yet...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Let's enjoy the dusk a while.

Speaker: on porch
Dialogue: Aaron is slowly scanning the terrain.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Mind you sweep up them shavin's.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Yes, Pa...  An' if you see any sage-hens, I'm ready.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It's all right, ma... I been watchin'...  Only I wish...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: What, Ben?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I wish Uncle Ethan was here. Don't you, ma?

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Mother, I can't see what I'm doing!...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: NOT YET, LUCY!...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: In the house, boy... and...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Ben, close the shutters.

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: Pa?

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: DEBORAH!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: I only took one, ma... Topsy was hungry.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: LUCY!

Speaker: lucy
Dialogue: I'm sorry... I couldn't find the shawl...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Hurry, Martha... Moon's fixin' to rise...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: We're going to play the sleep-out game... Remember?... Where you hide out with grandma?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Where's she buried?

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: And you'll go along the ditch -- very quietly -- like a...

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Like a little mouse.

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: There!... And you won't come back or make a sound... no matter what you hear? Promise!... No matter what?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: I promise... Wait!

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Child, child!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Can't I have Topsy to keep me company?

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: There's no time...

Speaker: martha
Dialogue: Here she is, baby... Baby...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Down low -- go!

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: Here dog... here!

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: She reached the ditch...

Speaker: aaron
Dialogue: She'll be all right, mother... she'll be all right.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Ethan!... Ethan!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Uncle Ethan... it's me... Martin!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Out of my way!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Mose! Wait!...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Ethan!... Mose!...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You stay out!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Nothing for you to see.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Leggo...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Don't let him go in there, Mose...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Lucy -- Lucy!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: ...and to Your keeping we commend the souls of Aaron... Martha... and Benjamin Edwards...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Man that is born of woman is of few days and full of trouble...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: He cometh forth like a...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Amen!... Put an 'amen' to it!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: ...like a flower and is cut down... Amen!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Charlie--you and Brad ride point! ...Don't get too far ahead...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'd be obliged if you'd get to the point, ma'am.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Come on, if you're comin'...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: We'll find them, Mrs. Jorgensen... We'll find them...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Another one, eh?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: This 'un come a long way 'fore he died.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Well, that's seven we can score up to your brother, Ethan.

Speaker: nesby
Dialogue: I don't like it.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: What don't you like?

Speaker: nesby
Dialogue: Injun's on a raid generly hides their dead so you won't know how many they've lost... If they don't care about us knowin', it only spells one thing... they ain't afraid of us followin' -- or of us catchin' up with 'em either.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You can back out any time, Nesby.

Speaker: nesby
Dialogue: Didn't say that...  What's he doin' that for...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: He wants to be sure...

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Let's get along...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Why don't you finish the job?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: What good does that do?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: By what you preach... none!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: But by what the Comanche believe -- now he can't enter the spirit land, but has got to wander forever between the winds... because I took his mangy scalp!

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: If only she's alive... I'll make it up to her... No matter what's happened... I'll make her forget... She's just got to be alive...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Get some rest!

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Could be a buffler...

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: It's horses, I tell ya...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: It's them all right...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: They're camped by the river -- 'bout twenty miles from here.  Soon's it gets dark we'll circle out so's to jump 'em before daybreak.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: You're right sure you want to jump 'em, Ethan?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: It's what we're here for, ain't it?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: I thought we were trying to get the girls back -- alive... We jump those Comanches, they'll kill 'em... You know that!

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: But... but what are we doin' then?... What are we supposed to do?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: What I had in mind was runnin' off their hoss herd... A Comanche on foot is more apt to be willin' to listen...

Speaker: nesby
Dialogue: That makes sense to me.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What do you know about it?... What's a quarter-breed Cherokee know about the Comanche trick of sleeping with his best pony tied right beside him... You got as much chance of stampedin' their herd as...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: ...as you have of findin' those girls alive by ridin' into 'em...  I say we do it my way, Ethan... and that's an order!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Yes, sir... But if you're wrong, Captain Clayton, don't ever give me another!

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Ay-he... They was here...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: SURE!... They WERE here... Now they're out there... an' waitin' to jump us!...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You got any more orders, Captain?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Just keep goin'...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Jus' bein' sociable, Cap'n...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Keep goin'...

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Look!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Easy!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: If you were tryin' to surround 'em, you sure succeeded.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: How far's the river from here, Mose?

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: I been baptized, Reverend... yes suh, been baptized, thank ye...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Well, you better brace yourself for another one... Ya-HEE!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: YA-HEE!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: This is as good as any... Charlie, you and Ed take the horses...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Minds me o' the time Joe Powers an' me fit us some Kiowas...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: You think they mean to charge us, Uncle Ethan...?

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: ...We found us an ole buffler wallow...

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Criminy!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Steady, Daniel Boone! You don't want to miss... It makes them think their medicine's stronger than yours...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Ay-he... That's jest what I tole Joe Powers... That un's gettin' kinda sassy, ain't he, Ethan?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Real sassy.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: I didn't give any order to fire!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That's all right, Captain... I don't need any formal invitation to kill a Comanch...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: You got one now!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Slack your shoulders... Slack 'em... Your hands'll take care of themselves...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: There goes yer scalp, Ethan!...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I still got one out there.

Speaker: clayton's voice
Dialogue: No, Ethan.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Let them bury their dead...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That tears it, Reverend... From now on, you keep out...  All of you!... I don't want you with me... I don't need you... for what I got to do!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: No need to shout, mister.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Reckon we got to go back -- Ed's shoulder is smashed -- bad!

Speaker: nesby
Dialogue: I can make it... just get me on a horse...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: No good, Ed... And Ethan's right... This is a job for a company of Rangers... or it's a job for one or two men... Right now we're too many... an' not enough...

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Only one way you can stop me lookin' for Lucy, mister... An' that's kill me...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: That's how I feel, Uncle Ethan...  Ethan, sir.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: All right... but I'm givin' the orders... You take 'em or we split up here and now...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Why, sure, Ethan... There's just the one thing we're after... finding Deborah and Lucy...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: If they're still alive...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: You boys got enough shells?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Vaya con dios.

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: They got to stop sometime... if they're human at all, they got to stop!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Naw... a human man rides a horse till it dies... then he goes on afoot... A Comanche comes along... gets that horse up... and rides it twenty more miles... Then he eats it.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Easy on that!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Sorry... We don't even know if Debbie 'n Lucy are with this bunch... Maybe they split up...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: They're with 'em -- if they're still alive.

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: You've said that enough!... Maybe Lucy's dead... maybe they're both dead... but if I hear it from you again, I'll fight ya, Mr. Edwards!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That'll be the day!... Let's ride.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Four of 'em cut out here... Why?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'll take a look... You keep after the others...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: You want us to fire a shot if...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No... nor build bonfires... nor beat drums neither. I'll meet you on the far side.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Oh... it's you.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I... uh... here's where they met up again...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Trail leads off there...

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Why'd they break off?  Was there water in that canyon?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Huh...?  No... no water.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: You all right, Ethan?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Huh...?  Sure I'm all right...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Say!... What happened to your blanket? Lose it?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Must've... Anyway, I ain't goin' back to look for it...

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: I saw her!... I saw Lucy!

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: They're camped 'bout two miles over... I was just swingin' back when I saw their smoke... I bellied up a ridge an' they was right below me...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Did you see Debbie?

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: No, but I saw Lucy all right... She was wearin' that blue dress... an' she was walkin' along...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What you saw wasn't Lucy.

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: It was, I tell you!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What you saw was a buck wearin' Lucy's dress...  I found Lucy back there in that canyon... I wrapped her in my blanket an' buried her with m'own hands... I thought it best to keep it from you -- long as I could.

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Did they...? Was she...?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What've I got to do -- draw you a picture?... Spell it out?... Don't ever ask me!... Long as you live don't ever ask me more!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: BRAD!...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Let's just hope he took some with him...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: What you goin' to do?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Get some sleep... Tomorrow's another day...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Say it. We're beat!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No... our turnin' back don't change anything... not in the long run. If she's alive, she's safe... for a while... They'll keep her to raise as one of their own, 'til she's of an age to...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: And you think we got a chance to find her?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: An Injun will chase a thing til he thinks he's chased it enough... Then he quits... Same when he runs... Seems he never learns there's such a thing as a critter that might just keep comin' on... So we'll find them in the end, I promise you that... We'll find them just as sure as the turning of the earth.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You got my letter about your son, Brad?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Yah... Just about this time a year ago...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: The Lord giveth--the Lord taketh away...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I ain't fit to go indoors, miz Jorgensen... These clothes is...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Martie!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Laurie.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: But I fairly forgot just how pretty you was...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Hey... What you doin'...?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Don't go takin' that stuff...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Ain't worth the mendin'...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: What you gettin' red-in-the-face for?... I have brothers, haven't I?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Well I ain't one of 'em!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I'm a woman, Martie...  We wash and mend your dirty clothes all our lives... When you're little we even wash you... How a man can ever make out to get bashful in front of a woman I'll never know...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: You talk like a feller might just as leave run around nekkid...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Wouldn't bother me...  I wouldn't try it in front of pa, though, was I you...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: ...an' then it snowed and we lost the trail... No need to tell ya all the places we went... Fort Richardson, Fort Wingate an' Cobb... the Anadarko Agency... Trouble is we don't even know which band that war party belonged to...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I got your boy killed.

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: It's this country killed my boy!... Yes, by golly!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Ma!... Martie's drawers is a sight! Ain't fit for rags!... Would it be all right if we gave him some of Brad's things?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: By golly, the letter... In the chest, mama... It came for you, Ethan... last winter...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Joab Wilkes of the Rangers brought it...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Mrs. Jorgensen...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Will you look at this?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You ever see it before... like mebbe on a dress Debbie wore?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No... not yet...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: ...not yet...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Might at least have left me my pants!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Shush!... Time for bed anyway...  Likely these'll need some takin' in... Oh, Martie, you're that gaunted! ...Ma's havin' a turkey for dinner tomorrow and...

Speaker: jorgensen's voice
Dialogue: Laurie!... Come... come!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Yes, Pa!... Good night, Martie... good night, Mr. Edwards...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Good night... Laurie...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Good night...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Jorgensen's been runnin' his cattle with my own...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: YOUR cattle?... DEBBIE'S cattle!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: He's agreed to take you on and share the increase from my herd while I'm gone... I'll be pushin' on tomorrow...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I ain't stayin'... I set out lookin' for Debbie... I aim to keep on...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Because she's my... my...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: She's your nothin'... She's no kin to you at all!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I always felt like she was... Her folks takin' me in, raisin' me like one of their own...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That don't make 'em kin...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: All right... I ain't got no kin... I'm goin' to keep lookin' that's all.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: How? You got any horses, or money to buy 'em... You ain't even got money to buy cartridges... Jorgensen's offering you a good livin' here...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Martin... I want you to know somethin'...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Yeah... you want me to know I ain't got no kin -- no money -- no horses -- nothing but a dead man's clothes to wear!... You tole me that already... Now shut your head!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Good night.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Ethan rode on... an hour ago.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I don't know what you can do about finding Debbie that he can't...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: He'll find her now, Martie... Please believe me... I know.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: That's what scares me -- him findin' her.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Laurie, I've seen his eyes when he so much as hears the word 'Comanche' ...I've seen him take his knife an' ...never mind... But he's a man can go crazy wild... It might come on him when it was the worst thing could be... What I counted on, I hoped to be there to stop him, if such thing come.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I hoped I could hold you here... But I guess I knew... So I stole this for you...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: 'I bought a small size dress off a Injun... If this here is a piece of yr chiles dress bring reward. I know where they gone... Jerem Futterman.'

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Futterman!... He's got a little tradin' post on the South Fork o' the Brazos... Laurie, I just got to get me a good horse! Think yer pa would...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Finish your breakfast...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I gotta catch up with him, Laurie!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Go on then! Pa's in the barn saddlin' the Fort Worth stud... an' you can take the light gelding with the blaze...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: But that's Sweet-face -- your own good horse.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Take it and welcome... but don't count on finding me here when you get back... I've been dallying around this god-forsaken wind-scour almost two long years waitin' for you... I ain't cut out to be an old maid!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I can't help it, Laurie... I just gotta catch up with Ethan...

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Andale! Andale!

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: Drink?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: How'd you come by this?

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: You said there'd be a thousand dollar reward.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That's what I said.

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: You got it with you?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Reward'll be paid when I find her -- an' if she's alive...

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: Man's got a right to expect some kind o' payment... I laid out for the dress an' sendin' you the writin'...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Twenty Yankee dollars.

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: ...an' a man's time is worth somethin'...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Talk!

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: A young buck fetched it in late last summer...  Said it belonged to a captive chile of Chief Scar...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Scar? Never heard of any Chief Scar.

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: Me neither... But this buck claimed he was a big war chief with the Nawyecky Comanches.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Keep talking.

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: Scar's band was headin' north... to winter in at Fort Wingate... eatin' agency beef. That's what this buck said... Maybe he lied.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: And maybe you lie...

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: In that case you won't find her -- and I won't get my thousand dollars.

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: Cards?... A jug?... If you'd like some company, we got a few squaws on the place...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No thanks.

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: Don't forget to come back with my thousand dollars.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Ain't yours yet.

Speaker: futterman
Dialogue: Bad manners... He shoulda said 'good- bye.'

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: Acts like somethin's out there.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Smells a change in the weather...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Wouldn't surprise me if we didn't have a frost 'fore mornin'... Here...  Whyn't you bed down closer to the fire, boy?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Hey! What's the idea...?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Maybe I'm gettin' like Mose Harper -- my bones is cold tonight...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Funny... When we passed through Fort Wingate last winter, we didn't hear mention of any Nawyecky Comanche there...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Not so funny... if you recollect what 'Nawyecka' means...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Sorta like 'roundabout' -- like a man says he's goin' one place when he means to go just the reverse...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Oh...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You all settled an' comfortable now?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Thanks... you did just fine...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Futterman?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: He just couldn't wait...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Whatchu doin'?...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Even got my twenty dollars back... We did all right.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: WE?... You just used me for bait -- staked me out like a... buildin' up the fire... fixin' it so's... I coulda had my brains blowed out!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Suppose you'd missed!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Never occurred to me...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Howdy, Mister Jorgensen...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Charlie...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Got a letter here...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: By golly! A letter?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: For Miss Laurie...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Yes'm... Figgered it might be the news you been waitin' for... so...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: No need to...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Yah?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I was just readin' to see if... Anyway, it's MY letter!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Maybe I'd better be goin'...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: You stay, Charlie... After all, Charlie brought the letter, Laurie... He got a right to listen too!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Oh, all right!  Well... Martin says...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: From the beginning...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: 'Dear Miss Laury'... He spells it with a Y instead of an I... E... Wouldn't you think he'd know...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Who cares what he spells it? Read the letter.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Dear Miss Laury... I take pen in hand to let you know Ethan and me still are trying to catch up with them Comanches the late Mister Futterman told us about...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: The late Mister Futterman?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: That means Mister Futterman is dead, by golly.

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: Soon we was meeting up with Kiowas an' Wichitas an' even some Comanches camped by one of the agencies...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: But none of them was Nawyecky's nor claimed to know a war chief named Scar... He's the one the late Mister Futterman said had Debbie...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: At one o' the agencies we outfitted with all kind an' manner of trade goods... figgerin' that'd make it easier for us to come an' go... You'd laugh if I told you what was our biggest seller...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: 'There is one other thing I got to tell you before you hear it from Ethan... How I got myself a wife'...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: A WIFE?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: He did?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Good! A young man should get married early in life. Right, mama?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Every young man should at least once...Go on, Laurie! Read!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: A little Comanche squaw - SQUAW!

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: My wife was a school teacher, Charlie ...She reads good.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I'll read it...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: So he married a Comanche squaw... Haw haw haw!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Let's go... I think I stumbled onto somethin'...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Scar?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: When are you goin' to learn to keep your mouth shut! Come on.  Let's get out of here.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: But I just bought a good blanket.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Forget it...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What I heard back there was that a band o' hostile Nawyeckas came through this way less'n two weeks ago...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Think it might be...?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What's she followin' for?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Look, I changed my mind... You can keep your blanket.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Go on back...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Look... you don't understand...  I don't want it.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: YOU don't understand, ya chunkhead! You didn't buy any blanket! Ya bought her!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You got yourself a wife, sonny!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Oh no! Tell her she's got to go back...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: And have her whole family after our scalps for floutin' one o' their women?... No sir! Come on, Mrs. Pauley...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Mrs... Pauley?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I got another gal purtier'n you.  I got another gal purtier'n you.  I got another gal purtier'n you.  Skip to my Lou, my darlin'.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Water!...  Pah!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That's the way to train 'em. Looks like Mrs. Pauley's goin' to make you a fine beautiful wife...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Cut it out, will ya...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Look... I wish I could explain to you.

Speaker: look
Dialogue: Look?...

Speaker: look
Dialogue: Nay tzare T'sala-ta-komal-ta-name... unt kang-yah Look. .

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Says her name's Wild Goose Flying in the Night Sky... but she'll answer to Look since it pleases ya...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Look?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I don't think it's so funny... If you want to do some good, whyn't you ask her where Scar is?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: She heard ya-all right... An' she knows...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Unt osupanet cah-nay Scar?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You ask her!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Look!  Do you know where he went? And if he has a girl with him... a white girl -- nai-bist pabo taibo...

Speaker: look
Dialogue: Mah nee-koo-ur?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: How do you say sister?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Nami.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Beats me how she could get that pony out o' camp without neither of us hearin' a thing...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: She ain't goin' back to her family, that's certain... not if she took off where the arrow points.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Think she means for us to follow?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: How should I know... She's YOUR wife!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I think maybe we oughta...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Yeah, I kinda figgered you'd say that... Bein' a new husband and all...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Maybe she left other signs for us to follow but we'll never know -- 'cause it snowed all day and all the next week... We were heading north, through the buffalo country when something happened that I ain't got straight in my own mind yet...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: Ethan's always been throwing it up to me that I'm a quarter-breed... I never figgered it made much difference...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: But this day we came on a small herd. We needed some meat so we circled 'round...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: ...and came up on 'em afoot...  They hadn't been hunted, so it was no trick workin' in close.

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: Ethan got a nice one on his first shot, but then he began killing one after another -- cows as well as bulls -- fast as he could fire and load... It was just a slaughter... no sense to it...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Ethan, quit it!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Ten!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: What's the sense in it!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Hunger! -- Empty bellies! That's the sense in it, you Cherokee!...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Least, THEY won't feed any Comanches this winter... Killin' buffalo's as good as killin' Injuns in this country.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Peaceful tribes depend on the buffalo, too....

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Ain't that too bad... If you feel that sorry for your kinfolk, I'm surprised you didn't take up with that squaw wife of yours...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: ETHAN!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Listen!... Hear it?... There! Ain't that a bugle... and firing?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Just hope we ain't too late...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: It was all over long before we got there and the soldiers was high- tailin' it back to the agency with their prisoners -- squaws mostly -- by the time Ethan and me reached the camp...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: It was the Nawyecky Comanches all right -- the ones we'd been looking for all this time...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: Trouble of it was that the soldiers had hit when most of the fightin' men was away -- huntin' maybe... So most of the dead was old men and women an' kids... And it was in one of the tepees Ethan found her -- the little squaw who wanted me to call her Look...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, you're a widower now...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: What'd the soldiers have to kill her for!...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Ethan!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Look! It's hers, Debbie's...

Speaker: martin's voice
Dialogue: So we knew Debbie had been in the village... What Look was doing there -- whether she'd come to warn them, or maybe to find Debbie for me... there's no way of knowing...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: We gotta catch up with them yellow legs... Maybe they got her with them.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: And maybe they got Scar!

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: We're looking for a girl -- a white girl...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: She'd be about thirteen now...

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: We got two around that age...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: You'll have to wait until we reach the agency... Fall in behind the column...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: But couldn't you...?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Sorry...  Keep the column moving!... Close ranks there!

Speaker: general
Dialogue: And it was clear to me the hostiles outnumbered us four to one... with all the advantage of terrain...

Speaker: correspondent
Dialogue: Four to one! What did you do, general?

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Sir -- we charged!... Gentlemen -- and I hope you will quote me -- I cannot say too much for the courage of the men who followed me into that Cheyenne camp...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Cheyenne! What Cheyenne?

Speaker: general
Dialogue: I beg your pardon?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That camp you hit was Nawyecka Comanche... Chief Scar's bunch...

Speaker: correspondent
Dialogue: Scar? What a wonderful name!...

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Are you getting this, Keefer?

Speaker: correspondent
Dialogue: How do you spell that word -- Nawyecka?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: My name's Edwards... I'm looking for my niece... she was in that camp when you attacked...

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Well... I know there were some captives recovered...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Four of 'em dead... so we were told...

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Unfortunately, the hostiles murdered them as we developed the village...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Are you sure they didn't die of carbine shots fired by a bunch o' Yank bluebellies so scared they couldn't tell the difference between a Cheyenne and a Comanche?

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Keefer!... Put this man under arrest!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That'll be the day...  'As we developed the village'... Next time you develop a village, hit it where the fightin' men are... You won't get any headlines for killin' squaws.

Speaker: keefer
Dialogue: Shall I show him the captives, sir?

Speaker: general
Dialogue: Just get him out of here!

Speaker: keefer
Dialogue: Yes sir...  This way...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Debbie?... DEBBIE?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Don't be scared, ma'am...

Speaker: keefer
Dialogue: Just don't pay any attention to her...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Debbie?

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Pabo-taibo!  The other girl has risen almost in the same instant -- but more out of fear. She is younger, but painted like the other. She moves to stand behind the savage one.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: No... She's not...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I ain't sure... Where's that doll?

Speaker: keefer
Dialogue: Was your niece about their age?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Not far from it...

Speaker: keefer
Dialogue: Hard to realize they're white, isn't it...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: They're not white any more -- they're Comanche!... Let's see the bodies...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I don't need you...

Speaker: keefer
Dialogue: I'd like you to see them all... It might help us identify them... Shot in the head -- flash-burn range... The boy got his skull cracked... Here's the girl...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, we only got the one lead -- Scar... And where we begin to look, I don't know...

Speaker: keefer
Dialogue: There's one thing. We recovered a bushel of trinkets in that camp... cheap stuff... trade goods... Couldn't help noticing that most of it was Mexican... Maybe if you could talk to some of those Mexican traders along the border... What do they call themselves?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Comancheros...

Speaker: keefer
Dialogue: That's the breed... Course it might take time.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Time's running out... But I'm obliged to you.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: ...so we're setting out for New Mexico Territory in the morning... I am sorry I won't be back for Christmas again this year...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: What's the difference!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: yours truly, Martin Paulie.'

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: They never find that girl.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I don't care if he never comes back!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Thought of saying 'no' never crossed my mind, Miz Jorgensen... No place I'd rather be than right here, right now.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: One old boot and a button shoe One old boot and a button shoe...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Recognize it?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: There couldn't be two like that in all the world...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: MOSE!.... MOSE HARPER?

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Ay-eh...?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Leggo my arm... You look mangier 'n ever.

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Ain't been too good... No sir, not too good... Gettin' old, Ethan...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You were born old...

Speaker: proprietor
Dialogue: Bienvenidos, senores... Pulque?... tequila?... mescal?... huiskey?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Tequila...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Lo mismo.

Speaker: proprietor
Dialogue: Y' par' el Viejo -- el vino del pais... tequila tambien!

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: I been helpin' ye, Ethan... I been lookin' all the time...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Thanks for nothin'...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, the reward still stands...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Don't want no money, Ethan... jus' a place -- a roof over m' head... a little grub... a bunk to sleep in... an' a rockin' chair by the fire... my own rockin' chair by a fire...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You help me find her, you got your rockin' chair...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Swear it, Ethan?... Given word?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Told ya, didn't I?

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Ethan... I found a man's seen her... knows where little Debbie is!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Who? Where is he... this man?

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: I am this man, senor... Emilio Gabriel Fernandez y Figueroa... at your service...  ...Always for a price...

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Un otra!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Come on, Don Juan... We're on our way...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Lemme alone...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You breeds are all alike -- two drinks an'...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Take yer hands off'n me... This lady an' me got some things to talk over!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Suit yourself... While you're enjoyin' your little conversation, I'll be ridin' out with Senor Fernandez here...  The Comanch' medicine country ain't far... there's one camp with a chief named Cicatriz.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Never heard of him...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Cicatriz is Mex for Scar... an' he has a white girl in his tepee... Be seein' you...

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Buena suerte, Estrella... Hasta la vista.

Speaker: estrella
Dialogue: Tu quieres...?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Sure... sure... Only not this year...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: 'Mind Ethan 'bout my rockin' chair!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Medicine country, huh?

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Medicine so strong they believe the feather of an eagle found here can guard a man against bullets...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: If you got one handy, now's the time...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: What are we waiting for?

Speaker: emilio's voice
Dialogue: Senores! This is Cicatriz!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Scar... It's plain to see where you got your name.

Speaker: scar
Dialogue: Your name - Big Shoulders... His name - He Who Follows.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You speak pretty good American for a Comanche... Someone teach you?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That's right... We come to trade... Only not out here...  I don't stand talkin' in the wind.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Miguel... caballo -- aca!

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Co-bay tabitz-chat.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Stay out here.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Not likely.

Speaker: scar
Dialogue: Pie-kay!

Speaker: emilio's voice
Dialogue: His sons are dead... So his wives sit on the honor side of his lodge.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Are those his wives too?

Speaker: scar
Dialogue: Two sons -- killed by white men... For each son, I take many scalps...

Speaker: scar
Dialogue: MAYAH-KAY ZEE-EH!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I've seen scalps before...

Speaker: scar
Dialogue: This before?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I came to trade, not to admire his collection... Tell him we're going to pitch camp across the crick... Maybe we can talk trade tomorrow.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Tomorrow -- manana -- 'puetze.'

Speaker: scar
Dialogue: Puetze!

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: If you gringo heretics have any prayers, say them...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: She's alive... Can you believe it, she's alive... alive... An' we found her...

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Please!... I, too, am alive... I wish to stay that way.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Vamanos!

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: You understand, senores... It is not that I am cobarde... cowardly...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Don't apologize... You did your job...

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: He knows you -- who you are -- and why you are here... This I did not understand... or I would not... even for gold, senores... have led you here.

Speaker: emilio
Dialogue: Take it. I do not want blood money. Vaya con Dios!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: You figger Scar means to kill us?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: He's got to... All these years, runnin', dodgin', knowin' we were after him... Now we caught up... It's him or us.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Why didn't he make his move back there?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I don't know... Somethin' tied his hands... maybe hospitality...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Debbie...?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Both men move closer. She takes a frightened step back, as if to run.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Debbie... Don't you remember me? I'm Martin.

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: Unnt-meah!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: We ain't goin'! We ain't goin' without you, Debbie... Ethan, get the horses... I'll try to keep her talkin'...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: How? She's even forgot her own language!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Debbie, you're comin' with us!  Hear me?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: No... not now... not ever.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I don't care what they've done to you... what happened...

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: They have done... nothing... They are my people...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Your people? They murdered your family!

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: White men killed them - to steal cows! I was... little... I ran away... They find me... take care of me.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: No Debbie! That ain't what happened! They been lyin' to you...

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: You lie! All white men lie... and kill...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Debbie, think back! I'm Martin... remember? Remember how I used to let you ride my horse? Tell you stories? Don't you remember me, Debbie?

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: I remember... from always... At first I prayed to you... come and get me... take me home... You didn't come...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I've come now...

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: These are my people...  Unnt-meah! Go! Go! Please!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Stand aside, boy...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Ethan -- NO!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Debbie! WAIT!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Never mind her! MOVE!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Go on! Get out of here while you can...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Over there!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: They'll be back...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: We won't be here... Come on!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Martha... Martha!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I gotta open that leg and let the poison out...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Wait...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Just in case... Read it.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: 'I, Ethan Edwards, being of sound mind and without any blood kin, do hereby bequeath all my property of any kind to Martin Pauley...'  I don't want your property.... 'Sides, what do you mean no 'blood kin?' Debbie's your blood kin...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Not no more.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I ain't forgettin' you was all set to shoot her yourself... What kind o' man are you, anyway.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: She's been with the bucks! She's nothin' now but a...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Shut your dirty mouth!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I hope you die!

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: They're here, mama... Come in, come in...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Here he is, Lars... Combed, curried 'n washed behind the ears!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Yes'm... scarcely reck'nize myself... Where's Laurie?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Say, that music sounds so good it must be sinful...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Well, now, a man of my age just can't haul off and dance in cold blood... but if there's any of that wild cherry brandy of yours, Lars...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Yah, by golly... One jug left... I get it!

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Hi!... You're late... hurry...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Ethan... Martie... No, don't get down! ...You can't come in!

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: The Rangers are here!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What's that got to do with us?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: What's goin' on?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Why, my Laurie's getting married...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Wait! Don't you hear me! The Rangers...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: So what?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: You been posted for murder... both of you... That trader fella, the late Mister Futterman...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I gotta see Laurie!

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Go around the side... the grandmother's room... I'll tell her... PLEASE!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: You better!

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Quick... hide in the barn, Ethan...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Hide? Why would I?

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Look everybody... Look who's...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Evenin'... evenin' Reverend... or do I call you 'Captain'...?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Came here for a wedding, Ethan... Until that's over, I reckon 'reverend' will do...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: She's not a little girl any more.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I've seen her... and she's alive.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Hello, Martie....

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I... I wrote you a letter... Reckon you didn't get it...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: One letter in five years... I read it till the paper dried up and the writing faded out...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: It wasn't much of a letter...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: No, it wasn't... You mighta said you loved me... You mighta asked me to wait... At least that'd have been something...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: But I allus loved you... You know that, without my sayin' it... I couldn't bring myself to ask you to wait... the little I had... not knowin' how much longer until we found Debbie...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: It isn't fair...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: It isn't fair, Martin Pauley, and you know it!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Don't cry, Laurie... I understand how it is... I'll just go 'way...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: You do and I'll die, Martie... I will! I'll just die!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I'll thank you to leave the room, Laurie.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Charlie MacCorry!... You weren't fixin' to marry HIM??

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: She sure is!... An' don't think your comin' back is goin' to change it!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: As to that, I don't know, Charlie... We hadn't got around to talkin' marriage...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: What right you got to be talkin' marriage to any decent woman...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: If you're talkin' about that crazy murder charge...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: AND other things... Mebbe you thought you was gettin' away with being comical about that Indian wife you took... I bet she wasn't the first squaw you...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Stop it! Both of you... I won't have any fighting in this house.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: It's all right... Charlie, let's move outside.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I ain't wearing no gun.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Sergeant MacCorry!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Is this in the line of duty, sergeant?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: No sir... pleasure.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: In that case, give the boys room...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Fight fair, son... Use your fists!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Comanches don't use their fists, reverend... Let 'em alone...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Could scalp him... but I'll just count coup!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: You all right, sergeant?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Dunno... Seems so.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Well, go get cleaned up and we'll proceed with the weddin'...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Ain't goin' to be any weddin' -- not till we get a few things cleared up 'round here...

Speaker: nesby
Dialogue: Well... it was a nice weddin' party... considerin' no one got married... 'Night.

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Good night, Ed...

Speaker: jorgensen
Dialogue: Now, mamma!...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: I got to ask you and Martin to ride to the State Capitol with me, Ethan.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: This an invite to a necktie party, Reverend?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Captain... Nope, wouldn't say that... Likely you had your reasons for killin' Futterman... Probably needed killin'... I'm speaking as a ranger now, not as a reverend... Fact that all three was shot in the back is the only thing that's raised some question -- that and a missin' gold piece known to have been on him just prior to his demise.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That so?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I ain't goin' to Austin, Reverend.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You're goin' if the captain says you're goin'...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Now, now... let's not grow disputatious...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: What's that? More company?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Kinda late getting here, aren't they?

Speaker: lieutenant's voice
Dialogue: Hello there! Captain Clayton?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Is Captain Clayton here, Reverend?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: I'm Clayton.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: You're Captain Clayton?...

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Colonel Greenhill's compliments, sir.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Hold on, son... Who's this Colonel Greenhill you're talking about?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Why Colonel Greenhill is Colonel Greenhill, sir... Commanding Officer, Fifth U.S. Cavalry... I'm Lieutenant Greenhill, sir.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Oh... Now what's this your pa wants to know?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: My pa wants to know... Colonel Greenhill wants to know how soon you could put a company of your Rangers in the field, fully armed and equipped, for joint punitive action against the Comanches.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: JOINT action?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Yes sir... We've received information about a band of Comanches under a chief named Scar...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What information?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: That maybe he's not far from here -- holed up somewhere, waiting his chance to get back over the border... He raided north about a month ago... ran into more army than he bargained for... Now he's running for cover, for keeps this time...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: And what makes you think he's in this territory?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Yesterday, one of our patrols picked up a man claims he was a prisoner with Scar till only two days ago... He talks crazy but I brought him along... Says he lives here... keeps mentioning a rocking chair.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Mose...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: MOSE!

Speaker: mose's voice
Dialogue: Ay-he?... Ay-eh?...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Come f'r my rockin' chai'... ole Mose.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Where's Scar, Mose... SCAR?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Ask him about Debbie!... Is she all right, Mose?

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: My rockin' chai'...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Mose... try to remember!... You were in Scar's camp...

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Ay-he... Made out I was crazy...  Ate dirt... chewed grass... I fooled 'em, Ethan!... an' I got away...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Scar! Where's he holed in?

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Seven Fingers... ay-he... Seven...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Seven Fingers?

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: That's what he told us... but there's no such place on the maps.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Wait a minute! Isn't that the Caddo name for where all those canyons branch on the Malapai?

Speaker: mose
Dialogue: Caddo or Kiowa... ay-he... ay-eh...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: You tell your pa a company of Rangers -- all fourteen of 'em -- fully armed an' equipped will be in the field by daylight... headin' for the south end of the Malapai. If he can catch up with us, well an' good...

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: But... but captain, we can't possibly take the field tomorrow... for your own protection...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Sonny, yonder's a passel of murderers, complete with Texican scalps an' white girl captive... You want to protect us, you just get out of our way... Now skedaddle!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Ethan, you an' Martin are hereby appointed civilian scouts -- without pay... Charlie, hightail it to headquarters an' spread the word...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Yes sir...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: My guns...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Martie... don't go! Not this time.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: You crazy?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: It's too late... She's a woman grown now...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I got to fetch her home...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Fetch what home?... The leavin's of Comanche bucks -- sold time an' again to the highest bidder?... With savage brats of her own, most like?...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Laurie! Shut your mouth!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Do you know what Ethan will do if he has a chance?... He'll put a bullet in her brain! And I tell you Martha would want him to!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Only if I'm dead!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: You ready?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I'm ready.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: We can get within 500 yards... there's a hogback to the south.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: How many, would you say?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Enough to go around... I'd say about a dozen apiece... Mount 'em up!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Wait! We go chargin' in, they'll kill her... and you know it.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: It's what I'm countin' on.

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I know you are... Only it ain't goin' to be that way... she's alive...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Livin' with Comanches ain't bein' alive...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: She's alive... Better she's alive and livin' with Comanches than her brains bashed out...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Now son, it's a bitter thing to say, but there's more than your sister at stake here.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: There sure is! I'm going to tell you somethin'... I wasn't going to speak of it... But I'll tell you now.  Did you notice them scalps strung on Scar's lance?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I saw it... And don't try to tell me it was Aunt Martha's or Lucy's...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You don't remember it, but I remember. That was your mother's scalp!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I didn't want to tell you... but maybe it's your right to know.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Now mount up, son...

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: It don't change it... All I'm askin' is a chance to sneak in there... an' try to get her out before you come chargin' in.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: What if you're caught?

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: It won't tell 'em anything, will it! Just a man alone...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I say NO!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Go ahead, son... But at the first alarm, we're comin' in -- and we ain't goin' to have time to pick and choose our targets when we do...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: It's your funeral...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Here... you fight like a Comanch... Maybe this'll help ya pass as one.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: What in...?

Speaker: greenhill
Dialogue: Captain Clayton... Captain!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Go on! Whyn't you have your bugler sound the charge while you're at it??

Speaker: greenhill
Dialogue: Sir?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Never mind... Your pa know you're out here?

Speaker: greenhill
Dialogue: Yes, sir... Troop's about ten miles back... The Colonel sent me looking for you...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Well you found me... Good work, son... Good work.

Speaker: greenhill
Dialogue: If there's anything I can do, sir...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: God forbid... No, son, you flog on back and tell your pa where we're at... and where he's at...

Speaker: greenhill
Dialogue: But he knows THAT, sir... Can't I stay, sir?

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: All right... But keep your eye on me, boy... I'm the hard case you're up against here -- not these childish savages... If you don't hear me first time I holler, you better read my mind... I don't aim to raise no two hollers on any subject at hand...

Speaker: greenhill
Dialogue: Yes, sir...

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Watch that knife, boy!

Speaker: comanche
Dialogue: Tahbo.

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: The State of Texas is payin' you boys $12 a month. Here's your chance to earn it... Now I don't want any foolin' around after scalps. We ain't got the time... Yankee cavalry's on its way here to set those Comanches free... We gotta beat 'em to it -- our way... Now mount an' guide center on young Greenhill here. Son, you just follow me... And WATCH THAT KNIFE!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: Debbie... don't!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: I'm takin' you whether you want to or not...

Speaker: debbie
Dialogue: MARTIN!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: For these Thy gifts which we are about to receive...  Sound that horn, son, and Leave Us Go Amongst Them...YA-HEE!

Speaker: martin
Dialogue: No, Ethan! NO!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'm sorry, girl... Shut your eyes...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You sure favor your mother...

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: Clayton, if you were in my command I'd have you courtmartialed for this!

Speaker: clayton
Dialogue: Hurry it up!

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: What's the matter, sir... You wounded? What is it, Sergeant -- a bullet or an arrow?
